autolaunch.title: Whether to autorun slideshow upon opening
autolaunch.description: Autorun slideshow upon opening if set; active only on notebooks that have a 'livereveal' or 'rise' section in their metadata; this provision is here to avoid starting RISE on regular notebooks that are not intended for slideshow.

enable_chalkboard.title: Whether to activate chalkboard

start_slideshow_at.title: Where to start the slideshow
start_slideshow_at.description: A string that describes where to start the slideshow this can be either `beginning` (start on first slide) or `selected` (start on the slide that contains the currently selected cell)

auto_select.title: What to select when new content appears
auto_select.description: a string that specifies how to select cells when new contents is displayed during the slideshow (typically, new slide or new fragment). It can be either `none` (no automatic selection), or `code` (select first code cell in new content).

header.title: HTML Header
header.description: the html text for a header that will show up on all slides. (effective only if `overlay` is not defined)

footer.title: HTML Footer
footer.description: the html text for a footer that will show up on all slides. (effective only if `overlay` is not defined)

backimage.title: Background image
backimage.description: a (relative) filename for a background image that will show up on all slides. (effective only if `overlay` is not defined)

overlay.title: HTML Overlay
overlay.description: some html text that will be inserted as-is on all pages. If this is provided, the 3 previous settings (header, footer and backimage) are ignored altogether.

theme.title: Reveal Theme
theme.description:
This setting, like the ones below, is passed directly to [`reveal.js` see this doc](https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js).
theme: [see a list of reveal's available native themes](https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js#theming). Note that dark themes from reveal do not work well with RISE, at least not without additional and manual tweaks.

transition.title: Reveal Transition
transition.description: at least available: none - fade - slide - convex - concave - zoom - cube - linear; see also `reveal.js`.

slideNumber.title: Reveal Slide Number
slideNumber.description: A string to specify if and how to number slides; [see reveal's explanations](https://github.com/hakimel/reveal.js#slide-number).

width.title: Reveal Width
width.description: A css width attribute, like `1920px` or `10cm` or `100%`. **Remember that you can always zoom in and out** with you browser's native keyboard shortcuts like typically `Command +` or `Command -`.

controls.title: Reveal Controls
controls.description: Add buttons to exit and get help

progress.title: Reveal Progress
progress.description: Show progress as a line at the bottom

history.title: Reveal History
history.description: Push each slide change to the browser history

auto_select_timeout.title: Timeout before auto-selection
auto_select_timeout.description: timeout in milliseconds before auto-selecting; all the timeout settings are mostly intended for developers.

restore_timeout.title: Timeout when restoring the focus
restore_timeout.description: timeout in milliseconds before restoring focus to selected cell when quitting slideshow mode; mostly intended for developers.

async_timeout.title: Timeout between synchronization
async_timeout.description: timeout in milliseconds before an extra call to Reveal.sync() is made to ensure proper display in some problematic conditions; like other timeout settings this is mostly targetting developers.
